sys_metadata_link.payload: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?><record_update sys_domain="09ff3d105f231000b12e3572f2b4775d" table="x_415531_rapid_ato_ars_3_1"> <x_415531_rapid_ato_ars_3_1 action="INSERT_OR_UPDATE"> <active>true</active> <activity_due/> <additional_assignee_list/> <approval>not requested</approval> <approval_history/> <approval_set/> <ars_id display_value="ARS 3.1">43903e93dbcd1010280df36f299619aa</ars_id> <assessment_methods_and_objects>Examine: Audit and accountability poli</assessment_methods_and_objects> <assessment_objective>Determine if the organization has implemented all elements of this control as described in the control statements and implementation standard(s).</assessment_objective> <assigned_to/> <assignment_group/> <assurance/> <baseline>High; Moderate; Low</baseline> <business_duration/> <business_service/> <calendar_duration/> <close_notes/> <closed_at/> <closed_by/> <cmdb_ci/> <comments/> <comments_and_work_notes/> <company/> <contact_type/> <contract/> <control_definition>The information system: a. Uses internal system clocks to generate time stamps for audit records; and b. Records time stamps for audit records that can be mapped to UTC or Greenwich Mean Time (GMT) and is accurate to within one hundred (100) milliseconds.</control_definition> <control_family display_value="Audit and Accountability">6887b9fcdb211010280df36f29961951</control_family> <control_name>Time Stamps</control_name> <control_number>AU-08</control_number> <control_type>Mandatory</control_type> <correlation_display/> <correlation_id/> <delivery_plan/> <delivery_task/> <description/> <due_date/> <escalation>0</escalation> <expected_start/> <follow_up/> <group_id>AU-08</group_id> <group_list/> <high>true</high> <impact>3</impact> <implementation_standards/> <knowledge>false</knowledge> <location/> <low>true</low> <made_sla>true</made_sla> <moderate>true</moderate> <number>ARSC0010879</number> <opened_at>2020-06-19 13:21:22</opened_at> <opened_by display_value="System Administrator">6816f79cc0a8016401c5a33be04be441</opened_by> <order/> <parent/> <priority>3</priority> <reassignment_count>0</reassignment_count> <reference_policy>FedRAMP Rev. 4 Baseline; FISCAM: AC-5, AS-2</reference_policy> <rejection_goto/> <related_controls>AU-3, AU-12</related_controls> <service_offering/> <short_description/> <sla_due/> <standard>NIST-800</standard> <state>1</state> <supplemental_guidance>Time stamps generated by the information system include date and time. Time is commonly expressed in UTC, a modern continuation of GMT, or local time with an offset from UTC. Granularity of time measurements refers to the degree of synchronization between information system clocks and reference clocks, for example, clocks synchronizing within hundreds of milliseconds or within tens of milliseconds. Organizations may define different time granularities for different system components. Time service can also be critical to other security capabilities such as access control and identification and authentication, depending on the nature of the mechanisms used to support those capabilities. - The correlation of monitoring tools that usually work in isolation (e.g., host monitoring, network monitoring, anti-virus software) can provide an organization-wide view and in so doing, may reveal otherwise unseen attack patterns; and - Consistent log timestamps facilitate effective event correlation.</supplemental_guidance> <sys_class_name>x_415531_rapid_ato_ars_3_1</sys_class_name> <sys_created_by>admin</sys_created_by> <sys_created_on>2020-06-19 13:21:22</sys_created_on> <sys_domain>09ff3d105f231000b12e3572f2b4775d</sys_domain> <sys_domain_path>!!!/!!!/</sys_domain_path> <sys_id>ec87b9fcdb211010280df36f2996197a</sys_id> <sys_mod_count>0</sys_mod_count> <sys_updated_by>admin</sys_updated_by> <sys_updated_on>2020-06-19 13:21:22</sys_updated_on> <task_for/> <time_worked/> <upon_approval>proceed</upon_approval> <upon_reject>cancel</upon_reject> <urgency>3</urgency> <user_input/> <variables/> <watch_list/> <wf_activity/> <work_end/> <work_notes/> <work_notes_list/> <work_start/> </x_415531_rapid_ato_ars_3_1> </record_update>
